name: Steigenberger Airport Hotel

reviews.text: stayed just one night here, room was clean and tidy, basic accomodation, good shuttle service to airport every 15 mins 24hrs a day. Good stop over hotel if you need one.
reviews.title: good location, great for short term

reviews.text: My wife, three-year-old son and I spent one night at the Steigenberger Airport Hotel in December 2009 after our flight home was cancelled.
reviews.title: Typical Airport Hotel

reviews.text: The Steigenberger is a quintessential airport hotel: functional, nice but not fancy, with impersonal service, mediocre food and overpriced amenities. You go there because you need a clean place to rest before journeying on. The Steigenberger serves this role as well as any other airport hotel. We had no complaints about our stay, but you will not see the Steigenberger on our list of vacation destinations.
reviews.title: Great proximity from Airport and nice German cuisine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is next to an office complex, which, in turn, has a gas station with a well-stocked convenience store. The gas station is only about a three-minute walk away but hidden behind other buildings. Look for it and buy your drinks, snacks and personal hygiene supplies there at much more reasonable prices (and with a much wider selection of items) than at the hotel.
reviews.title: Not Worth the Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A traveler's view of the Steigenberger may depend on the price he paid to stay there. The airline paid for our room, and so we were happy that the hotel was better than an average airport hotel. But I can see how someone could be disappointed if he expected something classier or, even worse, paid resort prices for his room.
reviews.title: Thankfully This Was For Just One Night

reviews.text: when ever I need to spend the night in Frankfurt to catch a plane, or transfer to a train... the Steigenberger is my choice. Accommodations are excellent, good food is readily available in the hotel, and easy connections to train and airlines.
reviews.title: Excellent stop over

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very pleasant stay on a stop-over of 1 night. Shuttle bus was very convenient. We were upgraded to an executive suite and it was fantastic. Very modern. Would have preferred to order off the menu for breakfast; the buffet was too expensive for what you would get.
reviews.title: Stop-over

reviews.text: It's very convenient to go there from Frankfurt airport by a shuttle bus every 15 minutes. Breakfast was wonderful, many kinds of tea to taste. The hotel restaurant outdoor is worth to try German Local food, we have been there every time when we stay at the hotel.
reviews.title: Business

reviews.text: Once you must be at an Airport Hotel you know what you can expect but in this hotel you must know that there is a secret treasure, just across the street there is huge wild forest ready for you, you can run, walk or pick up a bicycle at the hotel and enjoy this marvelous place. If it is raining you have a nice spa and gym at the ten floor. The rest of is good with great meeting rooms and regular rooms.
reviews.title: A secret place at the aairport

reviews.text: Stepping into my 3rd floor room was like stepping back into the 80's. It was basic but clean - but the colors - oh my - it was in line with David Hasselhof, Miami Vice and poodle haircuts. It wasn't really what I was expecting. I paid €143 through their website but on reflection it seems a bit overpriced for that.
reviews.title: An ok stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a long and tiresome overnight flight from the west coast of Canada our stay at this hotel was a very welcome start to our month holiday. We had been here a few years before.
reviews.title: Very elegant start to our holiday
Terrible!
reviews.text: I sometimes read other reviews and wonder if we are staying in the same hotel. We were greeted in a most friendly manner and given a room immediately. Our room was spacious and clean and the morning breakfast (although a bit pricey) was absolutely fantastic!
We set out the next day (on the complimentary airport shuttle) with great memories of our second stay at this hotel. A great start to a great holiday!
reviews.title: so so, nothing special, unfriendly check-out staff
Credit Card compromised at this hotel.
reviews.text: This is a terrible hotel as far as service and maintainance of the rooms are concerned. We were booked in the so called Executive Tower. We had to change the rooms twice (!) as the lamps did not work properly. This procedure took araound 2 hours of our badly needed relaxing time before an early flight next morning because they endlessly send people to our room to inspect, try to fix or just do nothing but find another room. Although we had reported the problem right after checking in and went for dinner, when we came back nothing had been done. We called the front desk and they told us, the service people could not do anything so they left everything as it was without telling us. Then the moving procedure began. When the lamps in our second room also did not work properly we asked to be upgraded for our troubles. The woman at the front desk told us we had already been upgraded, which was not true. In our third room the lamps worked but we were so upset that we could not sleep for a long time. Also the air conditioning was so loud, so maybe we could not have slept anyway. Next morning we brought our problems to the attention of the front desk manager and asked why the receptionist told us we had already been upgraded? He said, that this was true because we got rooms in the executive tower. I showed him my email booking which showed that I had booked and paid for exactly this type of room. He made a copy of my email and told us: Well, too bad... no apology, nothing. In the end he offered us a free breakfast but we were already too late and had to catch our flight. He then took the costs for two breakfasts off our bill. That was it!
Avoid this hotel at all costs!
reviews.title: Good airport hotel
Great hotel for an "airport stay"
reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night before leaving from Frankfurt airport on an early flight.
This hotel was sold out on all of the major websites but we called them and they had rooms available. They did not charge us a premium and our room was excellent.
reviews.title: Very close to the airport; nice and comfortable hotel

reviews.text: Reception: Efficient and Friendly.
reviews.title: Overnights

reviews.text: Room: Perfect, we stayed in the "executive towers" and had a fantastic room. The heated floor in the bathroom was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Dangerous bedside arrangement

reviews.text: My only complaint is that we had to pay for WIFI. Having paid 300 euro for a room for one night, one would think that internet access would be included but not the case. This is pretty poor for a hotel of this type.
reviews.title: Steigenberger Airport Hotel, Unterschweinstiege 16, 60549 Frankfurt, Hesse, Germany

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very convenient location with free 24 shuttle from Frankfurt Airport. Not a destination hotel, but great for an overnight stay to catch a flight. Very quiet rooms with everything you need. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Airport Hotel

reviews.text: If you need a place to stay when arriving in Germany this is the place. Clean, attentive staff and great Breakfast buffet. Our room was comfortable and soundproof. The front desk staff was really helpful and multi lingual. The bar area was great and reasonable. Overall a great place to start your trip.
reviews.title: what a great place near the airport

reviews.text: Only downside was the cost of parking.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - but expensive food and bisiness center
Cheap and poor service
reviews.text: Air Canada booked us into this hotel as our flight was cancelled.  Hotel Steigenberger is a nice hotel.  It is a short 5min shuttle bus ride from the airport.  The large shuttle us leaves every 15nin (20min at night). Our room was clean, had no odor and a queen size bed.   The A/C, running on high, was able to cool the room down by a few degrees, which is better than in most other German hotels.
The breakfast buffet has a huge selection of tasty foods.
reviews.title: Good convenient hotel, close to Frankfurt Airport

reviews.text: I spent Christmas Night at the Steinberger in order to meet a friend flying in from the U.S on Dec. 26th. I selected this hotel after reading reviews from Trip Advisor and the Hotel.info website.
reviews.title: Great Start for a Holiday Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Steinberger lived up to the positive reviews and their website description.
reviews.title: A superb airport hotel!

reviews.text: The shuttle was Very reliable and I was able to go back to the airport to explore after checking in.
reviews.title: Superb executive rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The "Open Sky" Lounge on the 9th floor is amazing for swimming, lounging and massages.
reviews.title: Perfect end of Vacation Hotel

reviews.text: As mentioned before, if you arrive late, the Esso station around the corner has an "On the Run" market with all kinds of food and drink. Plus the prices are very reasonable , compared to anything in the airport .
reviews.title: Not worth the money - not 5 star maybe a 3.5 star

reviews.text: I have twice stayed at this property and find it a good place for lodging the night before flying out of the Frankfurt airport. The staff is courteous, friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean, quiet and comfortable. The attached restaurant, reached by an out side walk way, has very good German cuisine and service. There is frequent airport shuttle service for the 5 minute ride to the terminal. Incredibly for an airport hotel there is no express check out. It lacks a lobby gift/snack/convenience shop. However, if budget requires, high food and minibar prices can be defeated by visiting the gas station/cafe about 100 yards away.
reviews.title: Good location to end business trip to Germany

reviews.text: They really have to be kidding. 5 star? This is no better than 3 star. The rooms are an absolute disgrace for a 5 star hotel. Absolutely tiny with no amenities in them whatsoever. TV stations are a disaster, the bed is uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Disgraceful - NOT 5 star by any means

reviews.text: Room service food was not edible. Just a burger for goodness sake. A decent hotel does not serve you a pre frozen patty. They serve a freshly made patty using decent meat. I could't eat the food.
reviews.title: Good Airport Hotel - 5 minutes away from Frankfurt International Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: NEVER to return. 200 Euro badly spent
reviews.title: Not sure why people are complaining about this hotel...

reviews.text: I would stay at this hotel again for the following reasons:
reviews.title: Average hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here during the Book Fair, and were pleasantly surprised. Our room, on the 8th floor of the Executive Tower, was incredibly spacious, modern, and comfortable. The bathroom alone was fantastic -- large and nicely appointed, with a terrific shower. As with most German hotels of this category, if you want top-notch shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, etc., bring your own. The Steigenberger's will do in a pinch, but don't expect Bulgari, or even l'Occitane. But, really, these are minor issues.
reviews.title: Surprisingly nice hotel

reviews.text: The Executive Tower rooms are large, modern, with views of the forest, flat-screen televisions, good workspace, and a small living area. Nespresso coffee machines allow you to get your cup of joe at your convenience. Overall, the Executive Tower rooms are very, very comfortable for those who are working during their travels, or who simply appreciate a bit of extra space.
reviews.title: Nice rooms

reviews.text: The room service continental breakfast is fantastic, and includes a hardboiled egg, yogurt, the traditional bread basket, and cold-cuts. In my case, the "continental" breakfast felt more like brunch.
reviews.title: First class service

reviews.text: We also highly, highly recommend dinner at Unterschweinstiege, for traditional German fare. Delicious food, great service, good value.
reviews.title: + Quiet + Good food; - disappointing reception desk; might reach general Steigenberger Standard with current renovation

reviews.text: The shuttle service to and from the airport is timely, and the drivers are good people who seem to genuinely care about the Steigenberger's guests. They, like the other employees of the hotel, go the extra mile for you.
reviews.title: For business without free wifi

description: Welcome to the Steigenberger Airport Hotel Frankfurt! The conference and business hotel with 570 rooms and 40 conference rooms at the Frankfurt Airport is the first choice address when it comes to business events and offers everything to make meetings, conferences, banquets, congresses or events a success. Only four minutes from Frankfurt Airport and reachable every 15 minutes with the free 24 hours Express-Airport-Shuttle, an oasis full of friendliness, professionalism and cosiness with a beautiful view into nature is awaiting you.
